Description: Sherd of large North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; orange clay with white inclusions and some silver mica; three concentric ridges on the underside and two more at centre; interior: cream slip; representation of a couch with two people on it; incision used for part of the details of bed and of people; added white details on leg and frame of couch and, much worn, on at least one leg of occupants; part of object, presumably on a table, preserved below couch. Drill holes on broken edge for analysis.
Curator's comments: From the same plate as Cairo 26145
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 284, no.803, pl. 112)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.812)
